children.text: Install Node.js and npm if not already installed.
Create a new React app using
Ensure Node.js and npm are installed before starting the project.
Follow the installation and setup instructions from the official React documentation to avoid any setup issues.
Define a clear component structure for the Todo app, considering components for adding, displaying, updating, and removing todos.
Avoid overcomplicating the component structure. Keep it simple and refactor as needed.
Think about which components need access to the state and how to structure the data flow.
Create basic components with minimal functionality and placeholder content.
Avoid overloading components with too much functionality initially. Start with basic rendering and layout.
component to add new todos to the list.
Manage state to store the list of todos.
or state update functions provided by React hooks.
component to display the list of todos.
Map over the list of todos and render
Ensure each todo has a unique key when rendering a list of components to avoid warnings and optimize rendering.
Allow users to mark todos as complete/incomplete.
Update the state to reflect the changes in todo completion status.
Avoid prop drilling by lifting the state up or using context API for managing the todo status.
Enable the deletion of todos from the list.
Update the state to remove the deleted todo from the list.
method to remove a specific todo from the list without mutating the original state.
Apply Styling and User Interface Design
Apply CSS styles to improve the visual appearance and user experience of the Todo app.
Consider responsive design to ensure compatibility with different devices.
Use a CSS-in-JS solution like styled-components for component-based styling, which can help avoid CSS class name conflicts and improve maintainability.
Test the app functionality and handle any potential issues or bugs.
Use developer tools to inspect component state, props, and debug potential issues.
Always test for edge cases and handle potential errors gracefully.
Use the React DevTools extension for debugging and inspecting the component hierarchy and state.
By following these tasks and tips, you can efficiently build a robust and functional Todo app while learning to avoid common pitfalls and best practices in React development
